title:
Feature:  Full Width Navigation 
on the MLB Homepage 
(1200px)
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps:
When the user hovers over each of the menu 
options in the top nav
custom_expected: Then a mega menu opens on hover on desktop at 1200px+

title:
Feature:  Full Width of 
Background Skins 
on the MLB Homepage 
(1680 pxl)
custom_preconds: Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When the user fully expands the screen
custom_expected:
Then the Nav items will span 1680 pixels 
(width of background skins)

title:
Feature:
Each menu item can have drop-down mega menus on hover on desktop
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing the menu items on the top Nav
custom_expected:
Each menu item can have drop-down mega menus on hover on desktop 
at 1200px+

title:
Feature:
Hovering only works at 1200px+
custom_preconds: Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When sizing the viewport at 1200px+
custom_expected:
Then hovering over ""NEWS"" in the navigation will open the mega menu 
and display "IN THIS SECTION."

title:
Feature:
Mega menus can support 10 items before it goes to a second column within dropdown
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing mega menus in the top Nav
custom_expected:
Then Megamenus can support 10 items before it goes to a second 
column within dropdown

title:
Feature:
All expanded items will be condensed and left-aligned under each item
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing the expanded items in the top Nav
custom_expected: Then All expanded items will be condensed and left-aligned under each item

title:
Feature:
Mega menu items are featured as Menu Items in Forge outputs
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing mega menu items
custom_expected: Menu Items are from Forge outputs (Forge dapi endpoints).

title:
Feature:
Items should be featured on the 
front-end in the order they are 
being returned
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing items on the front end
custom_expected: Then items should be showed in the same order they are returned from Forge (dapi endpoints).

title:
Feature:
Text field displays the name/title of each nav item
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing the title of each item
custom_expected: Then a text field displays the name/title of each nav item

title:
Feature:
Link refers to nav items URL
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing items in the top nav
custom_expected: Then the links should refer to the nav items' URL

title:
Feature:
Dropdowns refer to nav items URL
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing items in the top nav
custom_expected: Then the dropdowns should refer to the nav items' URL

title:
Feature:
Titles display as menu items with no link field
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing the menu item titles
custom_expected: Then titles should display as menu items with no link field

title:
Feature:
Menu button is present on all viewports and devices
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing the top Nav
custom_expected: Then the Menu button is present on all viewports and devices

title:
Feature:
Clicking on the 'hamburger' opens side menu
custom_preconds: Given: the user navigates to MLB or Club homepage
custom_steps:
Feature:
Clicking on the 'hamburger' icon opens side menu
custom_expected: Then the side menu opens

title:
Feature:
Open hamburger menu displays items in the same order as the Nav
custom_preconds: Given: the user navigates to MLB or Club homepage
custom_steps: When viewing the hamburger menu items
custom_expected: Then the the items should show in the same order as they do on the Nav

title:
Feature:
Verify logos and icons are rendering
custom_preconds: Given: the user navigates to MLB or Club homepage
custom_steps: When viewing the top Nav or Hamburger menu
custom_expected: Then logos and icons are rendering correctly

title:
Feature:
Allow the MLB Nav to go the full width of the page
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When viewing the MLB top Nav
custom_expected: Then the MLB Nav spans the full width of the page

title:
Feature:  "Menu" hamburger
tab
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When the user taps the 'hamburger' icon in the top nav
custom_expected: Then a side menu opens in the left rail

title: Feature:  'MLB logo' tab
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing any page but not the 'home' page'
custom_steps: When the user clicks the "MLB" logo in the top nav
custom_expected: Then the user is returned to the MLB site home page

title: Feature: "Scores" tab
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the 'home' page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When the user clicks the "Scores" tab in the top nav
custom_expected: Then an array of scores and/or scheduled games displays in the left rail

custom_expected:

And titles should display as menu items with no link field

title: Feature:  Side Menu
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps:
When the user clicks the 'hamburger' menu button in the top 
nav (far-left)
custom_expected: Then the 'side menu' opens

title: Feature:  Side Menu Options
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps:
When the user clicks the 'hamburger' menu button in the top 
nav (far-left)
custom_expected:
Then a 'side menu' opens
And the user is able to view the navigation options which match the Forge dapi endpoint: 
(e.g.)
   - Scores
   - News
   - Video
   - Standings
   - Stats
   - Schedule
   - Players
   - MLB.TV
   - Tickets
   - Apps
   - Shop
   - Auction
   - Fantasy
   - Play Ball
   - Teams
   - EN

title: Feature:  Side Menu Icons
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps:
When the user clicks the 'hamburger' menu button in the top 
nav (far-left)
custom_expected:
Then a 'side menu' opens
   And the user is able to view the subject icons on each of the side menu options
   - MLB.TV
   - News
   - Schedule
   - Scores
   - Video
   - Tickets
   - Home
   - Apps
   - Fantasy
   - Login
   - Playball
   - Search
   - Standings
   - Stats
   - Teams

title:
Feature:  Side Menu 
Mega Menus
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps:
When the user clicks the 'hamburger' menu button in the top 
nav (far-left)
And a 'side menu' opens
And the user hovers over an option in the menu 
(showing a right arrow)
custom_expected: Then a mega menu 'flies out' on hover on desktop at 1200px+

title: Feature:  Side Menu Content
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When the user opens and views options in the side menu
custom_expected:
Then Items in the side nav will have the same drop-downs/flyouts as the 
top nav

title: Feature:  Side Menu Overlay
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When the user opens and views options in the side menu
custom_expected:
Then the open side nav should act as an overlay and darken the rest of the 
page behind it

title: Feature:  Items in side nav
custom_preconds:

   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When the user opens and views options in the side menu
custom_expected:

top nav

title:
Feature:  
Mega Menu Content 
in Side Navigation
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When the user hovers over each of the options in the side nav
custom_expected:
Then Mega Menus display a total of 20 items ; 10 in each column
And the "Teams" mega menu displays 30 teams
And flyout items are split w/wrapping, rather than extending down 10 
   items in one column (e.g. if a list of 7 (or more) items, split into 4 and 3
   If 9 items, balance with 5 and 4)
And All expanded items will be condensed and left aligned under each item
And the text field is the name/title of each nav item
And the link link refers to the nav items URL 
      (Note: some links are in relative URL form,
      others absolute URL form If the link field starts with http, assume it is absolute.
      If link field starts with /, assume it is relative and construct it accordingly.
      If there is a menu Items with no link field, it should be treated as a Title within the
      megamenu list)

title: MLB Nav is SEO friendly
refs: Testable when navigation updates are made available on Prod
custom_preconds: Given: the user navigates to a web search engine
custom_steps: When the user searches for 'MLB'
custom_expected: Then the search engine (e.g. Google) renders all content/links through the Google Search Console.

title: MLB Club Nav is SEO friendly
refs: Testable when navigation updates are made available on Prod
custom_preconds: Given: the user navigates to a web search engine
custom_steps: When the user searches for an MLB Club (e.g. Dodgers)
custom_expected: Then the search engine (e.g. Google) renders all content/links through the Google Search Console.

title:
Feature:
Navigation tabs in focus as user tabs through
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
   And the MLB icon is in focus in the top nav
custom_steps: When the user presses the 'tab' key on keyboard
custom_expected: Then the 'focus' moves (right) to the next tab in the top navigation

title:
Feature:
Mega menu links in focus as user tabs through
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps:
When the user hovers over a tab in the top nav
   And the corresponding mega menu opens
   And the user presses the 'tab' key on keyboard
custom_expected: Then the focus 'moves' through the options in the mega menu

title:
Feature:  
Shift-tab navigate tabs backward
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
   And navigates to to focus to a middle tab in top nav
custom_steps:
When the user presses and holds the 'shift 'tab' key 
   And then presses the 'tab' key on keyboard
custom_expected: Then the 'focus' moves (left) backwards to the next tab in the top navigation

title:
Feature:
Return/Enter key loads selected interactive element
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps:
When the user hovers over a tab in the top nav
   And the corresponding mega menu opens
   And the user hovers over an option in the mega menu
   And the hovered option is highlighted
   And the user presses the 'return/enter' key on keyboard
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the corresponding page

title:
Feature:
Return/Enter key when there is no menu
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps:
When the user hovers over a tab in the top nav that has no
mega menu
   And the user presses the 'return/enter' key on keyboard
custom_expected: Then the user is brought to the corresponding item's page

title:
Feature:
Escape key dismisses selection
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps:
When the user makes a selection from a mega menu
   And the user presses the 'esc' key on keyboard
custom_expected: Then the menu closes and the 'focus' returns to the element that opened the menu

title:
Feature:
Hitting return on the MLB logo while on the homepage reloads 
the page
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When the user clicks the "MLB' log in the top nav
custom_expected: Then the home page is reloaded

title:
Feature:
Tabbing within the Teams mega menu
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And has opened the "Teams" mega menu
custom_steps: When the user tabs through the "Teams" mega menu
custom_expected:
Then the tabbing moves thorough team-by-team, division-by-division
e.g. Baltimore > Boston > New York, etc.
AL East > AL Central > AL West > NL East, etc.

title:
Feature:
Tabbing through side navigation
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And has opened the side navigation menu
custom_steps: When the user presses the 'tab' key on keyboard
custom_expected: Then the focus moves from tab to tab down the menu

title:
Feature:
Return/enter activates the flyout menu
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And has opened a side navigation menu
custom_steps:
When the user is on a tab in the side nav
   And the tab is in 'focus'
   And the user presses the 'return/enter' key on keyboard
custom_expected: Then the flyout mega menu is activated

title:
Feature:
Dismiss the flyout menu
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
   And has opened a side navigation menu
   And has opened a flyout mega menu
custom_steps: When the user presses the 'esc' key on the keyboard
custom_expected: Then the flyout mega menu is dismissed

title: Feature: Searching for Active Players in L/XL Viewports
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://beta-aws.mlb.com/
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When the user select the Player Search field at the top far right of the navigation bar and enters the name of an active player
custom_expected: Then the Player Search field will display a list of active players that the user can select

title: Feature: Selecting an active player from the Player Search Dropdown
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://beta-aws.mlb.com/
   And is viewing the page at 'full screen'
custom_steps: When the user select an active player from the Player Search field drop down
custom_expected: Then the user is brought to the player page

title: Feature: Searching for Active Players in S/M Viewports
custom_preconds:
Given: the user navigates to https://beta-aws.mlb.com/
   And is viewing the page at 'S/M'
custom_steps: When the user select the Player Search field at the top of the side menu and enters the name of an active player
custom_expected: Then the Player Search field will display a list of active players that the user can select
